definition: Monopoly (game)/known as 地產大亨|地产大亨[Di4 chan3 Da4 heng1] in Taiwan
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)

sentences.english: Zillionaire Wallet, a wallet to amuses you and others.
sentences.chinese: 大富翁钱包，娱人娱己的趣味钱包。

sentences.english: He believed that a wildly rich uncle in South America was going to leave him a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他坚信南美有个大富翁叔叔要留给他一笔遗产。

sentences.english: You're wasting your time playing Monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 玩‘大富翁’游戏是在浪费时间。

sentences.english: The world is racketing around at an ever madder pace.
sentences.chinese: 她一直与大富翁为伴，过着花天酒地的生活。

sentences.english: Do you want to be a moneybags ?
The moneymaking venture made him rich.
sentences.chinese: 这个投机赚钱事业让他成为大富翁。

sentences.english: Play an hours-long game of Monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 玩他数小时以上的大富翁游戏。

sentences.english: Hurt the most: Warren Buffett, America's second-richest citizen.
sentences.chinese: 影响最大的是美国第二大富翁瓦伦巴菲特。

sentences.english: The new taxes will not touch the very rich .
sentences.chinese: 新的税法对那些大富翁不会有丝毫影响。

sentences.english: Two years ago, Hasbro came out with an electronic version of Monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 两年前，孩之宝公司推出了一个电子版的大富翁游戏。

definition: Monopoly (game)/known as 大富翁[Da4 fu4 weng1] in PRC
